hero.headline: IME Record Review in Minutes — AI Summaries for IME Physicians
hero.subheadline: You shouldn't spend more time reading records than performing the evaluation. Dodonai's AI summarizes claimant medical records into structured chronologies so you walk into every IME fully prepared.

sections.heading: The Pre-Exam Prep Bottleneck
paragraphs: A typical IME case file lands on the doctor's desk with 200 to 1,000+ pages of treatment records, imaging reports, operative notes, and pharmacy logs. Reviewing all of that before an evaluation takes time you don't have — especially when you're scheduled for multiple exams per day.
Most IME physicians either skim the records and risk missing something relevant, or spend their evenings catching up on chart review. Neither approach is sustainable when case volume is high.

Dodonai's {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|AI medical record summarization}} reads the entire record set and produces a structured chronological summary you can review in minutes. Every diagnosis, procedure, medication change, and provider encounter is extracted and organized — with page references back to the source documents when you need to verify a detail.

cards.title: Review Records in Minutes
cards.description: Get a complete chronological summary of the claimant's medical history — diagnoses, treatments, surgeries, medications, and provider encounters — without reading every page yourself.

cards.title: Structured Chronologies
cards.description: The AI organizes records into a clear timeline. See the full treatment trajectory at a glance — from initial injury through the most recent visit — so you understand the case before the exam starts.

cards.title: Page-Referenced Findings
cards.description: Every data point in the summary links to its source page. When you need to verify a specific diagnosis, lab result, or operative note, you go straight to it.

cards.title: Medical-Specific Extraction
cards.description: The AI understands medical terminology, abbreviations, and handwritten physician notes. It extracts clinical details that generic document tools miss.

cards.title: Customizable Output
cards.description: Configure summaries around the areas that matter to your evaluation — specific injuries, body systems, date ranges, or providers. {{link:/dodonai-extract-and-draft-agents/|Extract and Draft Agents}} let you build reusable templates matching your reporting preferences.

cards.title: HIPAA Compliant
cards.description: HIPAA compliant with signed BAAs on every account. SOC 2 Type II certified and AES-256 encrypted — your claimant records never touch a training pipeline.

items.title: Upload the Claimant's Records
items.description: Upload the full record set — PDFs of any size, including scanned documents, faxed records, and handwritten notes. Specify focus areas like body systems, date ranges, or specific providers if needed.

items.title: AI Generates the Summary
items.description: Dodonai reads every page, identifies key medical events, and produces a structured chronological timeline alongside a narrative summary. Diagnoses, procedures, medications, imaging, and provider encounters are extracted automatically.

items.title: Review and Prepare for the Exam
items.description: Scan the chronology to understand the claimant's full treatment history. Click through to source pages for any detail you want to verify. Export in PDF, Word, or Excel to reference during the evaluation.

faq.question: How long does it take to summarize a typical IME record set?
faq.answer: Most record sets are summarized in minutes, regardless of size. A 500-page case file and a 50-page file are processed at the same speed — you're not waiting hours for results.

faq.question: Can the AI handle handwritten physician notes and poor-quality scans?
faq.answer: Yes. Dodonai's {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI OCR engine}} processes handwritten notes, scanned documents, and faxed records. It extracts text from low-quality images so nothing clinically relevant is missed.

faq.question: Can I customize the summary to focus on specific injuries or body systems?
faq.answer: Yes. You can specify focus areas — body systems, date ranges, providers, or injury types — so the summary highlights what's most relevant to your evaluation.

faq.question: How do I verify the AI's output against the original records?
faq.answer: Every finding in the summary links back to its source page in the original document. Click any data point to see the exact page it came from.

faq.question: What does it cost?
faq.answer: Per-page pricing with no minimums or seat fees. Visit our {{link:/pricing/|pricing page}} for current rates.

faq.question: Is the platform HIPAA compliant?
faq.answer: IME records contain claimant PHI that falls under strict federal and state privacy rules. We sign a BAA before your first upload, encrypt everything with AES-256, and hold SOC 2 Type II certification. Your records never enter any training pipeline — and you choose when they're deleted.
